Tesla Model S Batteries Violently Explode In Fatal Crash
$TSLA https://www.google.com/amp/jalopnik.com/tesla-model-s-batteries-violently-explode-in-fatal-cras-1788561054/amp?client=safari

links.title: Tesla Model S Batteries Violently Explode In Fatal Crash
links.description: A Tesla Model S crashed into a tree in downtown Indianapolis early this morning, killing both of its passengers and bursting into flames, WTHR reports. The crash sent battery cells "firing off almost like projectiles around the rescuers," Indianapolis Fire Department told the news site.

links.title: Analyzing the Auto Industry before the US Presidential Election
links.description: High Stakes: US Auto Industry Awaits the US Presidential Election PART 1 OF 3 The US presidential election will take place on November 8, 2016. links.title: Why I Would Still Buy NVDA Stock Today: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA)
links.description: Although year-to-date, NVDA stock is already up 108.6%, it still has room to rise further. The new Nintendo Switch could attract high demand, which would aid NVIDIA's revenues and profits. The revelation that all new Tesla models would be capable of self-driving could open a great market for NVIDIA.

links.title: Patent Data Show That Companies Invent in Very Different Ways
links.description: Numerous books have been written about how businesses innovate, but most rely on case studies. The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office recently took a more data-driven look. It analyzed patents for employees at three large tech companies in varied fields: Tesla ( top) in electric vehicles, Facebook ( bottom) in social networks and Intrexon ( middle) in genetic engineering.
